qas.question: What is energy abbreviated to in science?
What is frequency also known as in science?
What term describes a small amount of element?
What did the light quantum, in some ways, behave as?
What was later termed the photon?
When did Max Planck first recognize the value of the Planck constant?
Which scientist associated the Planck constant with a quantum five years after Planck's recognition?
Instead of an electromagnetic wave, what did the light quantum behave as in some regards?
What is the simple name given to the light quantum today?
In what year was the value G associated by Einstein with quantum theories of energy?
Who discovered an association between the value G and quantum energy?
What type of charge did a particle have that behaved similarly to dark quantum energy?
What term describes a large amount of element?
What is the simple name given to the dark quantum today?

context: First recognized in <a5_0>1900<a5_0/> by Max Planck, it was originally the proportionality constant between the minimal increment of energy, <a0_0>E<a0_0/>, of a hypothetical electrically charged oscillator in a cavity that contained black body radiation, and the frequency, <a1_0>f<a1_0/>, of its associated electromagnetic wave. In <b9_0>1905<b9_0/> the value E, the minimal energy increment of a hypothetical oscillator, was theoretically associated by <a6_0><b10_0>Einstein<b10_0/><a6_0/> with a "<a2_0><b12_0>quantum<b12_0/><a2_0/>" or minimal element of the energy of the electromagnetic wave itself. <a4_0>The light quantum<a4_0/> behaved in some respects as <a3_0><a7_0>an electrically <b11_0>neutral<b11_0/> particle<a7_0/><a3_0/>, as opposed to an electromagnetic wave. It was eventually called <a8_0><b13_0>the photon<b13_0/><a8_0/>.
